comments:
I get an exception if running a report twice.

The report consists of a table and a crosstab. The crosstab-query is quite complex (with simple queries I do NOT get the following exception).

If I runAndRender the report a second time, I get the exception that is pasted below.

I debugged birt down to the class "DataRequestSessionImpl", operation createCube() which starts like this:

private void createCube( TabularCubeHandle cubeHandle,
			CubeMaterializer cubeMaterializer, Map appContext )
			throws IOException, BirtException, DataException
{
  boolean doPerfTuning = this.needCachedDataSetToEnhancePerformance(cubeHandle)
  && ( appContext == null || ( appContext != null
  && appContext.get( DataEngine.DATA_SET_CACHE_ROW_LIMIT ) == null
  && appContext.get( DataEngine.MEMORY_DATA_SET_CACHE ) == null ) );


doPerfTuning computes to "true" - so it looks as if birt is trying to use internal caching. This explains, why I do not get the exception the first time, but any time after that.

The bug seems to be connected to a binding problem between the cube and the dataset. Maybe the caching of the first run does not work correct, so that the binding cannot be found in the second run.

If I change the doPerfTuning to "false", the report always runs without a problems.


Here comes the exception:


Column binding "Buying" has referred to a data set column "buying_name" which does not exist.Column binding "Buying" has referred to a data set column "buying_name" which does not exist. ( 2 time(s) )

Hello, Carsten Wolters. Would you please attach the report design file that triggers this bug? And for "runAndRender the report a second time", any code sippet is appreciated, thanks!
This bug should have been fixed in a recent check in. Please update to latest build for a try.
